org.ndnx.ndn.io
Class NDNAbstractOutputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.OutputStream
      org.ndnx.ndn.io.NDNAbstractOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable
Direct Known Subclasses:
NDNBlockOutputStream, NDNOutputStream
public abstract class NDNAbstractOutputStream
extends OutputStream

This abstract class is the superclass of all classes for writing an output stream of bytes segmented and stored in NDN.

See Also:
for description of NDN segmentation

Constructor Detail

NDNAbstractOutputStream

public NDNAbstractOutputStream(ContentName baseName,
                               KeyLocator locator,
                               PublisherPublicKeyDigest publisher,
                               SignedInfo.ContentType type,
                               ContentKeys keys,
                               NDNSegmenter segmenter)
Base constructor for all output streams. The behavior of an output stream derived class is determined largely by its buffering, segmentation configuration (embodied in a NDNSegmenter) and flow control (embodied in a NDNFlowControl, contained within the segmenter), as well as the way it constructs is names.

Parameters:
baseName - specifies the base name to write. Can be null, and set later.
type - specifies the type of data to write.
locator - the key locator to be used in written segments. If null, default is used.
publisher - the key with which to sign the output. If null, default for user is used.
segmenter - The segmenter used to construct and sign output segments, specified by subclasses to provide various kinds of behavior.

NDNAbstractOutputStream

protected NDNAbstractOutputStream()
Special purpose constructor used in tests.

Method Detail

startWrite

protected void startWrite()
                   throws IOException
Override in subclasses that need to do something special with start writes (see NDNFlowControl#startWrite(ContentName, Shape)). They should call this superclass method, though, to initialize keys (may need to move this later).

Throws:
IOException

addOutstandingInterest

public void addOutstandingInterest(Interest outstandingInterest)
Method for streams used by NDNFilterListeners to output a block in response to an Interest callback. We've received an Interest prior to setting up this stream. Use a method to push this Interest, rather than passing it in in the constructor to make sure we have completed initializing the stream, and to limit the number of constructor types. (If the Interest doesn't match this stream's content, no initial block will be output; the stream will wait for matching Interests prior to writing its blocks.)

Parameters:
outstandingInterest - An interest received prior to constructing this stream, ideally on the same NDNHandle that the stream is using for output. Only one stream should attempt to put() a block in response to this Interest; it is up to the caller to make sure that is the case.

getBaseName

public ContentName getBaseName()
Returns:
The name used as a prefix for segments of this stream (not including the segment number).

Returns:
The version of the stream being written, if its name is versioned.

Returns:

The digest of the first segment of this stream or null if no segments generated yet.

firstSegmentNumber

public Long firstSegmentNumber()
Returns the first segment number for this stream.

Returns:
The index of the first segment of stream data or null if no segments generated yet.

getSegmenter

protected NDNSegmenter getSegmenter()
Returns:
The NDNSegmenter responsible for segmenting and signing stream content.

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int timeout)
Set the timeout that will be used for all content writes on this stream. Default is 10 seconds

Parameters:
timeout - in milliseconds
